title: The Elder Scrolls V Skyrim
review:
This game isn't as vast and expansive as Oblivion, but people must understand that with today's technology, it would take a signifigantly larger amount of time and resources to recreate something that big with a new engine.

That being said, the enviornment is still extremley varied, and assuming you don't fast travel all the time, it's still a huge map. The enemies are varied, combat feels satisfying when you beat someone, and many new or improved features exist because of the developer's lessons learned from Oblivion, and Fallout 3/NV. This game will feel familar, yet different.

In some time the Development tools will be released for PC, and the game can only get better.

Highly reccomended it to anyone who can pull themselves away from the cliches of BF3 or MW3.

title: The Elder Scrolls V Skyrim
review:
Grab your closest country-sized skillet. Take the low fantasy setting of Oblivion, mix with the near perfection that was Fallout 3. Add a huge wallop of great story and intriguing side-quests. Sprinkle with dragons. Pop into the oven for five years. Perfection. (Best served cold.)

Kotaku describes the Skyrim Sandbox Melange as follows: "You can return to the [main quest] at any time, but there's a whole wide world to be explored, and what the hell, it's not like [the Big Bad] set a date for the destruction of everything; overwhelming evil's flexible work schedule is one of my favorite aspects of the series. Unhampered by a ticking doomsday clock, the player is free to reconnoiter the beauteous countryside of Skyrim to their heart's content."

And what a (dragon-filled) beuateous countryside it is! Buy it! play it! Live it!

title: The Elder Scrolls V Skyrim
review:
The question is not whether you SHOULD buy this game, but rather, why the heck shouldn't you!? 

I've spent more time just walking around, enjoying the environment of Skyrim than I have in any other game to date. The short of it? Skyrim is totaly breathtaking. 
It's one of those game that proves that environmental design and placement is alot more important than flashy textures, effects and sun rays! 
If your not fighting the undead (or raising them to fight for you) then your catching butterflys as they land on wild flowers.
If your not stealing everything from the citizens of a riverside village, then your climbing precariously to the peak of a mountain only to find a dragon awaiting you! 
This game no doubt has its bad points but I have yet to find them and any small glitches and inperfections are lost in amongst the most gripping rpg that you will ever likely play.

Get this! Play this! LOVE THIS!!

title: The Elder Scrolls V Skyrim
review: I never...ever enjoyed Elder Scrolls, I have played the first game to this game and I could never get into or hooked on them but by far I am hooked on SKYRIM!, and the epic youtube rap that goes with it! This game has everything an RPG player looks for. Intense battles where quick decisions always need to be made and of course...DRAGONS! Nothing like slaying a giant dragon and then sucking up its soul. But along with dragons there are tons of beasts and other humans / creatures you run into in this game and just so your not always alone in towns all over SKYRIM there are plenty of people willing to assist you whether it be by payment or simply delivering a letter. I Recommend this game to anyone who is looking for a good hack and slash, spell blasting, bow shooting good ol' time. 10/10 in my book!

title: The Elder Scrolls V Skyrim
review:
Before I start, I have never liked singleplayer RPG style games

Simply the greatest singleplayer open world F/3rd Person RPG I have played since The Legend of Zelda: Ocarina of time on the old N64!! (This isn't a turn based rpg)

Massive world, you can go anywhere; I am yet to find a location where I can't get to within the worlds boundaries.
Avewsome graphics, sounds, quests - there are a-LOT of them, overall its fantastic.
The best bit is, the storyline is variable based on who you work with and the manner in which you perform expected tasks in the game. The story still goes from A to B, but everything inbetween makes it more like 000AAA to 999ZZZ.
Roles intermingle allowing you to explore different races and specialisations to suit whatever gamestyle you like, whether it be a mage, an assasin, an archer, or a melee figher.

If you have been looking for a good adventure game, this is totally worth its price.
Also you dont need to know the prior games, plenty of backstory to go.

title: The Elder Scrolls V Skyrim
review:
I remember being a bit on the fence on buying this, but after reading a couple of previews, watching some videos, I decided to pick it up. I launched the game, and several years later I emerged from my apartment.

This game is so incredibly immersive, if you let yourself be immersed. There's a huge open world, a million things to do, and always lingering feeling that there's always more to explore. 

If you like open worlds, role-play games (somewhat akin to Dragon Age: Origins), then I can only heartily recommend this game for you. Just be sure to inform your family members so that they know you're safe.

title: The Elder Scrolls V Skyrim
review:
Completely garbage UI. Insanely boring main quest. And how can anyone make a post Red Dead Redemption game where the horses control like tanks? The animations are still scarily inhuman, and your companions are as erratic as a squirrel on crack, and about as useful.

Weird. I thought this was going to be a perfect Elder Scrolls Game, but while they've taken a bunch of steps forward... Morrowind still had more ambition and depth, and was much larger in scale, and scope. A step backward if you ask me. 

Oh well. Time for mods.

title: The Elder Scrolls V Skyrim
review: Dude, just go get this game. It might not have the best story ever, it might not have the best combat, and it might not have the best graphics, but it's one of the best RPGs ever created. You can do pretty much whatever you want. You can steal things, be a pickpocket, craft things, hunt dragons, join a rebellion, be a murderer, be a champion, be a bad guy, be a good guy, or just wander around. No matter what you want to do, or where you want to go, Skyrim will put something there for you to enjoy. The amound if content here is overwhelming.

title: The Elder Scrolls V Skyrim
review:
Holy Crap: Even with its dated graphics which still hold very well atleast for scenery (up close, it seems a tad bit too low res), the story and roleplaying elements make much up for the somewhat glitchy graphics. So far after finishing two of the larger Factions (Thief Guild and the Dark Brotherhood) I have already been well satisfied for the full price I paid for the game. And I have yet to even finish the main game! The Dragons however do respawn (to my dismay)... 

There is also a huge variation of things to do from Dungeoneering, Mining (oh god), Blacksmithing, Questing (normal aside,there are definetly randomly generated Assassination gigs, as well as thief quests so far that I've discovered), Torture (yes, to get info on where they have hidden their treasure (see generated quests) ), or simply lots of places to Explore and Clear. While I doupt I'd be playing long after finishing most of the larger quest lines, I'd probably pop into Skyrim every now and then to simply play in it.

title: The Elder Scrolls V Skyrim
review: There are times when some games touch the fine line between video gaming and art.﻿ Skyrim is definitely at the top of the list. Is it a perfect game? Nothing is perfect, and nothing appeals to everyone. It is, however, a clear testimony of what can be achieved through vision, passion and love of one's work. That is what Bethesda offered respectfully to all of us. A huge 'thank you' to Todd Howard and everyone who worked on Skyrim. And Jeremy Soule, you're the man.

title: The Elder Scrolls V Skyrim
review: Well, I usually do not write a review until I have finished the game, or at least put enough hours into it to make sure I know most of the game content, but Skyrim is a different story. In fact, the story is amazing, the conbat feels a lot better and gameplay all around is amazing. The graphics are really good also if you have a nice machine to ramp up to ultra settings. The set pieces are amazing also. Most times you wander into a town, duneon or any other area and it just bewhilders you of the amazing artistry that is present. The music and sound is also amazing! We cannot leave out the new perk system. Like FO3, every level you gain, you get to invest a perk into any of the trees available, and wow, there are many. I could go on, and on about the great things of Skyrim, but I will hit a bad note. The interface. In fact, I have no idea why they have messed up the interafce so bad since others have done it well. Great game overall, but the interface is probably the biggest downside.

review:
The best computer game ever. I'm going to be losing weeks of my life to exploring the cold and icy landscapes of Skyrim. Delving into mines, smashing through dungeons, rollocking around forts and sneaking into wherever I can find gold.

I've been waiting for over a year for this release - having worn out two pc game discs (and an Xbox) playing Oblivion over the years, on console and pc, I was worried this release of the Elder Scrolls title might disappoint.  Thankfully Bethesda have pulled out all the stops with great graphics, fantastic story development, great little Easter eggs for TES fans and much improved voice acting. 

If you don't already own it buy it now. This is a gaming cultural phenomenon, make sure you are part of gaming history and start playing now.

99/100

title: The Elder Scrolls V Skyrim
review:
This game is magnificent. It grows upon the success that was Oblivion in a great way. Almost everything has been improved in some way. The graphics are better, and it all around feels like you're there.

Besides the occasional hilarious looking glitch (Ex: My follower swimming through air, I almost pissed myself laughing) the only other problem I have is that the master volume is WAY too low. I have to turn up my volume to the point where the game is now audible, but Steam messages are deafening. Most other glitches are quite typical with Bethesda games however.

I completely reccommend this game. If you enjoyed previous Elder Scrolls games, you'll love this. If you're new, the story might be a bit more confusing, but not that hard to pick up.

My score: 9.5/10 - Not perfect, but damn near close.

title: The Elder Scrolls V Skyrim
review:
Absolutely beautiful. Skyrim has the same feel as award winning Oblivion except with updated graphics and playability. The world is huge and beautiful, and even on the lowest graphic settings it still looks pretty dam good! Skyrim functions more as a Fallout style game, from its lockpicking to its killing blows. The human companion system is awful, especially in tight tunnels when your try to make a tactical retreat and your companion blocks you to your death. The Menu system also feels like a downgrade, and (as far as i can see) the hotkey system has been replaced with a 'favorites' button and bides everything to Q (it gets cluttered quick).

All in all though Skyrim as a whole is easily one of the leading contenders for 2011 Game of the Year. Watch your back batman!

title: The Elder Scrolls V Skyrim
review: I WILL NEVER LEAVE MY ROOM.

title: The Elder Scrolls V Skyrim
review: First off the graphics are better than its predecesor but not top of the line yet. Gameplay is much improved, easier combat and the spell system is very much better than any of the other Elder Scrolls magic systems. Bethesda has built off of parts from Fallout New Vegas where you can make your own weapons and armor at different sites throught the world, making your own upgrading what you have and finding the raw materials for it all are pretty fun side quests when you aren't wanting to tackle another dungeon just yet. Overall Skyrim is the best RPG I have seen on the market to date.

title: The Elder Scrolls V Skyrim
review: Behold, Skyrim! And with its release, a new standard for PC gaming is born! This game is truly spectacular, breathtaking, brilliant, and thoroughly awe-inspiring. The amount and quality of detail, graphics, sound, content, voice acting, realism, and sheer imagination poured into this masterpiece of a game make it the epitome of creative passion. Finally, a game with extraordinary hype which is easily and almost immediately justified. This instant-classic will no doubt earn numerous awards, and along with them the hearts of millions. Rating this game a mere 10 out of 10 is simply not enough.

title: The Elder Scrolls V Skyrim
review: From the 45 minutes I've played of this game, I've realised that I have been deprived from truly great games. The land of Skyrim is like nothing I've experienced before. I cant remeber the last time I've truly felt free in a game. I have always been giving inspiration by beautiful games, but I have never experienced one of this magnitude. When a true gamer hears the term "It's only a game" they just smile and nod. But when the truth of the matter is that these are more than games, they are an artwork. They give inspiration. They give hope. They make you someone else in a far off land. They change the view of our repetitive lives.

A true masterpiece.

title: The Elder Scrolls V Skyrim
review: If you've been looking for a great successor to Morrowind, this is your ticket. This game takes everything good from Morrowind as well as the small parts of Oblivion that succeeded, and goes so much further without sacrifice. While not everything is entirely new, it's new enough in many regards to feel completely refreshing. Combined with beautiful visuals and excellent sound quality and you've got a potential game of the year. Highly recommended.

title: The Elder Scrolls V Skyrim
review:
Hard and rough right from the beginning, that's how you start a game. Or maybe you want so see a decapitation, burning soldiers and villagers?
The fifth part of "The Elder Scrolls" takes place in Skyrim, a cold  northern land where icy winds and war agonises lords as well as there tributarys. 
All is in the right set to spend evening after evening in this beautiful world. Deep and scary dungeons, large woods and mountains to explore, also an epic choir lifted by the mightiest orchestral music ever in a game mesmerizes you to the screen. 
But there is something. 
And that something is a pseudofuturistic menu that stabs you in the back everytime you have to use it,... If you can ignore such a little blemish, you'll have one of the most fascinating gamingexperiences since 2006.

Minor quips: the character creator isn't as robust as the last game, sometimes you can't get out of menus, and the character skill tree is sometimes less functional than desired... but all in all, amazing. If there's one game you should wish were a woman so you could marry this year, it'd be Skyrim!

Recommended to a broad variety of gamers.

title: The Elder Scrolls V Skyrim
review:
This is such a great game. I've already created a level 21 Nord character. Boy, it's a blast. The graphics are stunning! You can see the details on each individual plant and leaf. One leaf blew right by my face as I was walking down the beaten path of a mountain and I sat there for literally 15 minutes just thinking "wow" at the magnificent detail of the leaf. This is the greatest game of the century, until another good game comes. I wouldn't be surprised if I were to have a "special" time with some of the female models in this game. They are that realistic. 

This is the greatest game in the world!! I love it!!
